books.author: Dostoevsky, Fyodor
books.title: Crime and Punishment
books.description: A psychological drama exploring guilt, morality, and redemption through the story of Raskolnikov, a man who commits murder.

books.author: Tolstoy, Leo
books.title: War and Peace
books.description: A sweeping epic that intertwines the fates of five aristocratic families during Napoleonâ€™s invasion of Russia.

books.author: Plato
books.title: The Republic
books.description: A Socratic dialogue concerning justice, the ideal city-state, and the education of rulers, introducing the allegory of the cave.

books.author: Hesse, Hermann
books.title: Siddhartha
books.description: The story of a young man's spiritual journey during the time of the Buddha, seeking enlightenment and self-discovery.

books.author: Tolstoy, Leo
books.title: Anna Karenina
books.description: A tale of love, betrayal, and social constraints, revolving around the tragic love affair of Anna Karenina and Count Vronsky.

books.author: Hesse, Hermann
books.title: Steppenwolf
books.description: A profound exploration of an alienated man torn between his wild and civilized self, struggling to find meaning in life.

books.author: Dostoevsky, Fyodor
books.title: The Brothers Karamazov
books.description: A philosophical and spiritual inquiry into faith, free will, and morality, following the complex dynamics of the Karamazov family.

books.author: Plato
books.title: Phaedrus
books.description: A dialogue that explores love, rhetoric, and the nature of the soul, providing insights into Plato's thoughts on the human condition.

books.author: Tolstoy, Leo
books.title: The Death of Ivan Ilyich
books.description: A novella that examines mortality and the meaning of life, following the existential crisis of a dying man.

books.author: Hesse, Hermann
books.title: The Glass Bead Game
books.description: A complex intellectual novel set in a distant future, where a scholar contemplates the meaning of intellectualism and life.

books.author: Plato
books.title: Symposium
books.description: A philosophical text in which various characters give speeches in praise of love, discussing the nature and purpose of human desire.

books.author: Dostoevsky, Fyodor
books.title: The Idiot
books.description: Prince Myshkin, a kind and naive man, returns to Russia and becomes entangled in a web of greed, love, and betrayal.
